subject: Self Care
title: The Self-Compassion Break
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Self-Compassion Break.

hook.text: In under sixty seconds you can shift from self-attack to self-compassion. Neff calls it the self-compassion break.

buildup.text: Step one: 'This is a moment of suffering.' Step two: 'Suffering is part of life.' Step three: 'May I be kind to myself.'

discovery.text: Each step maps to a pillar: mindfulness, common humanity, self-kindness. The break activates all three at once.

twist.text: The phrases feel scripted at first. With practice they become natural â€” a mental first-aid kit for difficult moments.

climax.text: Practice the break during small frustrations. Build the muscle before you need it for the bigger storms.

punchline.text: Three phrases. Sixty seconds. A complete compassion reset.

quiz.question: What are the three steps of the self-compassion break?
options: Acknowledge suffering, remember shared humanity, offer self-kindness
